content.rendered:
Munnar Alleppey Tour Package

Home » India » South India » Munnar Alleppey Tour Package

Tour Overview

The Munnar Alleppey Tour Package offers a perfect blend of hill station charm and serene backwaters over four days.

Your journey begins with a scenic drive from Cochin to Munnar, a picturesque hill station known for its lush tea plantations, wildlife sanctuaries, and cool climate. After settling into your hotel, you can relax and enjoy the natural beauty of Munnar before embarking on a sightseeing tour the next day. Explore the stunning Rajamalai National Park, the picturesque Mattupetty, and the scenic Top Station, known for its vast tea plantations and breathtaking views.

On Day 3, you'll travel to the tranquil town of Alleppey, famous for its backwaters, houseboats, and picturesque landscapes. After a relaxing evening on a houseboat or in a hotel, enjoy a delicious breakfast before heading back to Cochin on Day 4 for your departure. This 4-day, 3-night tour ensures a memorable experience, combining Munnar's natural beauty with the serenity of Alleppey’s backwaters, leaving you with lasting memories of Kerala's finest landscapes.

Read more

Itinerary Details

Day 1 :Arrive Cochin – Munnar

On arrival at Ernakulam Railway Station/Cochin Airport you will be welcomed by our representative and he will take you transfer to Munnar (Approx 155KMs/ 5hrs). Munnar means “The three rivers” which are situated at the confluence of three mountain streams Nallathanni, Muthirapuzha (Kannimalayar), and Kundala. Munnar is an attractive hill station full of natural resources located at an altitude of 6000 ft from sea level; this hill station is the part of Idukki district. The temperature stays here between the range of 5 °C to 25 °C in winter, and 15 °C to 25 °C in summer. There are several hot plantations of tea, cardamom, coffee, and other spices, dark forests & wildlife sanctuaries.

At arrival to Munnar just check in to your hotel, Welcome drink would be offered after you get fresh at the comfort of your room. Rest of the time enjoy leisure at the hotel, you can enjoy the scenic beauty of Munnar also. Stay overnight at the hotel in Munnar.

Day 2 :Munnar Local Sightseeing

Post breakfast, get ready to experience an amazing local sightseeing of Munnar, which includes the visit to Rajamalai National Park, Mattupetty, and Top Station.

Rajamalai National Park-this national park is also known by the name of Eravikulam National Park, it is situated in Idukki, which is the bordering district of Kerala and Tamil Nadu. You can see some of the rare animal species can be found here- you may see Elephant, Nilgiri Marten, Nilgiri Langur, small-clawed otter and a rare tiger or leopard and the Nilgiri wood pigeon etc.

Mattupetty-It is approx 15 KMs away from Munnar, this is an extremely picturesque hill station.

Top Station–is placed at the approx distance of 40KMS from Munnar, and a well-known spot for the highest tea plantation in India. Later on arrive back and check in to the hotel. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Day 3 :Munnar - Alleppey

Just finish your breakfast, we’ll take you to Alleppey (190 KMs / 5 Hrs). Alleppey is a scenic and popular town for its marvellous backwaters, it will attract you by its natural appeal. Alleppey is also known for its Boat races, Beaches, Houseboats, Marine Products and Coir Industry. In evening return back to your hotel/houseboat and check in to relax overnight.

Day 4 :Alleppey- Cochin (Departure)

In the morning time enjoy your breakfast at hotel/ houseboat. Later check out from the houseboat/hotel and we’ll take you towards the Cochin airport (90 KMs /2 hrs) / Ernakulam Railway Station (60KMs/1 Hr 15Min Approx) for your onward journey. We hope that you’ve enjoyed your tour and wish to arrange your next tour soon.

Price Details

Tour Name Munnar Alleppey Tour Package
Duration 04 Days / 03 Nights
Destinations Cochin - Munnar - Alleppey
